name: intral production | intral | Cutoff, U
description:
ecoQuery: https://ecoquery.ecoinvent.org/3.10/cutoff/dataset/9026/documentation

This dataset represents the production of 1 kg of intral (pyrite) from pyrite in the gorund.;Land-use is an approximation based on iron ore extraction. Material and energy inputs, industrial machine, and particulate emissions are an approximation based on iron mining and limestone crushing and milling.;[This dataset was already contained in the ecoinvent database version 2. It was not individually updated during the transfer to ecoinvent version 3. Life Cycle Impact Assessment results may still have changed, as they are affected by changes in the supply chain, i.e. in other datasets. This dataset was generated following the ecoinvent quality guidelines for version 2. It may have been subject to central changes described in the ecoinvent version 3 change report (http://www.ecoinvent.org/database/ecoinvent-version-3/reports-of-changes/), and the results of the central updates were reviewed extensively. The changes added e.g. consistent water flows and other information throughout the database. The documentation of this dataset can be found in the ecoinvent reports of version 2, which are still available via the ecoinvent website. The change report linked above covers all central changes that were made during the conversion process.]

From pyrite in ground.

This activity ends with the production of 1 kg of intral (pyrite). The dataset includes raw materials, machineries and energy consumption for production, emissions to air from production and infrastructure of the site. The dataset doesn't include water emissions, overburden and tailing material from process, and losses of product.
category: B:Mining and quarrying/08:Other mining and quarrying/089:Mining and quarrying n.e.c./0891:Mining of chemical and fertilizer minerals
tags: Sector: Resource Extraction; Minerals; Agriculture & Animal Husbandry

processDocumentation.geographyDescription: Data are used here as European average.
processDocumentation.technologyDescription: As a first approximation, the technology is based on iron mining, limestone crushing and limestone milling technologies. The overall yield is assumed to be 90%.

exchanges.description:
Intral is a brand name for mono-crystalline pyrite and is used for producing amber glass. Pyrite belongs to the mineral class of sulfides, contains quite a high percentage of iron but along the iron mining history was never a source for the iron production. It has been always mined for its sulphur content.
EcoSpold01Location=RER
